feed.title: Google Cloud: Apigee UI
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Apigee UI

entry.content:
Show all rows in the Debug properties panel

Fixed an issue where only the first 50 rows were displayed in the Debug properties panel, including the variables tab. The Debug properties table now displays up to 200 rows per page by default. Pagination controls are displayed if the total number of rows exceeds 200.
entry.summary: The Debug properties panel previously limited to 50 rows now displays up to 200 rows by default. Pagination is enabled for tables with more than 200 rows, ensuring all data is visible.
entry.title: Fixed: Debug properties panel now shows more rows

entry.content: On January 27, 2026, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: An updated version of the Apigee UI was released on January 27, 2026. This release includes improvements and new features for enhanced user experience.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee UI Update Released

entry.content:
Debug v1 turndown

As of January 20, 2026, Debug v1 has been turned down and is no longer available. Please use Debug v2 (now referred to as Debug) for debugging API proxies.
entry.summary: Debug v1 is no longer available as of January 20, 2026. Please migrate to Debug v2 for API proxy debugging.
entry.title: Deprecated: Debug v1 turndown

entry.content: On January 12, 2026, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: An updated version of the Apigee UI was released on January 12, 2026. This update includes improvements and new features for a better user experience.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee UI Update

entry.content:
Manage environment-level resources in the Apigee UI

You can now manage environment-level resources using the Apigee UI. Previously, environment-level resources could only be managed using the API. For more information, see Managing resources.
entry.summary: You can now manage environment-level resources directly within the Apigee UI. This feature previously required the API for all environment resource management tasks.
entry.title: Feature: Manage environment resources in UI

entry.content:
On December 19, 2025, we released an updated version of Apigee Monetization.

Note: Rollouts of this release to production instances have begun. Rollout may take four or more business days to complete across all Google Cloud zones. Your instances may not have the feature available until the rollout is complete.
entry.summary: An updated version of Apigee Monetization has been released. Rollout to production instances is underway and may take several business days to complete across all zones.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee Monetization Updated

entry.content:
Monetization now supports AppGroups. Use AppGroups to manage API product subscriptions for all app developers in the AppGroup at the same time.

For more information, see Use AppGroups to manage API product subscriptions.
entry.summary: Monetization now supports AppGroups, allowing you to manage API product subscriptions for all developers in a group simultaneously. This feature simplifies subscription management for your API ecosystem.
entry.title: Feature: Manage Subscriptions with AppGroups

entry.content: On December 17, 2025, we announced that Debug v1 will be shutdown on January 15, 2026. Use Debug v2 instead of Debug v1.
entry.summary: Debug v1 will be shut down on January 15, 2026. Please transition to Debug v2 for continued debugging capabilities.
entry.title: Announcement: Debug v1 Shutdown

entry.content: On December 17, 2025 we released a new version of the Apigee integrated portal.
entry.summary: A new version of the Apigee integrated portal was released on December 17, 2025. This update brings improvements and new features to the platform.
entry.title: Announcement: New Apigee Portal Version Released

entry.content:
Incorrect Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy header in developer portal

A fix has been implemented to address an issue where the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy response header in the developer portal was malformed with an extra colon. This change ensures the security header is correctly formatted.
entry.summary: An issue with a malformed Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy header in the developer portal has been fixed. The header was incorrectly formatted with an extra colon. This update ensures the security header is now correctly configured.
entry.title: Fixed: Developer Portal Header Fix

entry.content: | Bug ID | Description | | --- | --- | | 446973091 | Proxy editor endpoint view is now disabled if there are over 200 flows configured in proxy endpoints. When opening the proxy editor endpoint view with a proxy that has over 200 flows, the proxy graph is no longer rendered, and instead you are presented with a message informing you that there are too many flows to render. This action addresses a performance issue that made the proxy editor unusable when there were over 200 flows configured. |
entry.summary: The proxy editor endpoint view is now disabled when more than 200 flows are configured in proxy endpoints. Instead of rendering the proxy graph, a message informs users about the excessive number of flows. This change resolves a performance issue that previously made the editor unusable in such cases.
entry.title: Fixed: Proxy editor endpoint view disabled for over 200 flows

entry.content: On November 17, 2025, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: The Apigee UI has been updated. The new version was released on November 17, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Updated Apigee UI Released

entry.content: On November 17, 2025 we released an updated version of Apigee Analytics.
entry.summary: An updated version of Apigee Analytics was released on November 17, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee Analytics Update

entry.content:
Support for aggregate data in Error Code Analysis, Cache Performance, and Target Performance charts

Announcing support for viewing aggregate data in the Error Code Analysis, Cache Performance, and Target Performance Analytics dashboards.

For information on the Analytics dashboards, see Use the Analytics dashboards.
entry.summary: We're happy to announce that you can now view aggregate data in the Error Code Analysis, Cache Performance, and Target Performance Analytics dashboards.
entry.title: Feature: Aggregate Data Support in Analytics

entry.content: On November 12, 2025, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: A new version of the Apigee UI was released on November 12, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee UI Update

entry.content: | Bug ID | Description | | --- | --- | | 455584175 | Fixed a performance issue with Debug session UI Fixed an issue where performance of the Debug session was severely degraded when loading a Debug session with a moderate number of transactions. |
entry.summary: A performance issue that caused the Debug session UI to degrade significantly when loading a moderate number of transactions has been resolved.
entry.title: Fixed: Performance issue with Debug session UI fixed

entry.content: On November 10, 2025 we released an updated version of Apigee.
entry.summary: An updated version of Apigee was released on November 10, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Updated Apigee Version Released

entry.content:
Support for new Apigee Analytics regions

This release introduces Apigee Analytics support for these new regions: Hong Kong (asia-east2) and São Paulo (southamerica-east1).

NOTE: Apigee Advanced API Security does not support these new regions at this time.

For a list of all of the supported Analytics regions, see Available Apigee API Analytics regions.
entry.summary: Apigee Analytics now supports Hong Kong and São Paulo.
entry.title: Feature: New Regions for Apigee Analytics

entry.content: On November 2, 2025, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: An updated version of the Apigee UI was released on November 2, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee UI Update

entry.content:
The Apigee Classic UI shutdown is complete. The shutdown was finalized on November 2, 2025, completing the migration of Apigee to the Google Cloud console. All Apigee functionality is now available in the Apigee UI in the Google Cloud console.

See the Apigee Classic UI shutdown page for more details.
entry.summary: The Apigee Classic UI has been shut down as of November 2, 2025, completing the migration to the Google Cloud console. All features are now accessible via the Apigee UI within the Google Cloud console.
entry.title: Deprecated: Apigee Classic UI Shutdown

entry.content: On October 30, 2025, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: A new version of the Apigee UI was released on October 30, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee UI Update

entry.content: | Bug ID | Description | | --- | --- | | 443120120 | Fixed an issue where an incorrect target URL or cURL command was displayed in the proxy debug properties window. New generated debug sessions now contain information in a flow info event that describes the values used by the proxy to call the target endpoint. The debug UI displays these values and uses them to generate the target URL and curl command displayed in the debug properties window when the target request event is selected. If some of the header fields are masked in the debug session, a warning appears next to the Copy cURL button. If the headers are truncated due to system limitations, Copy cURL is disabled. Older debug sessions that do not have the new target endpoint information no longer attempt to display the target URL or generate a cURL command as they were unreliable. A dialog is displayed warning you of this when attempting to open older debug sessions. |
entry.summary: Resolved an issue with incorrect URL and cURL commands in proxy debug properties. Debug sessions now provide accurate information for target URLs and cURL commands, with warnings for masked or disabled fields.
entry.title: Fixed: Proxy Debug Properties Update

entry.content: On October 7, 2025, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: An updated version of the Apigee UI was released on October 7, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Updated Apigee UI Released

entry.content:
Output from print statements is now displayed in the Debug session viewer

A new option has been added to the transaction navigation table header in the Debug session viewer that opens the Transaction output window. The Transaction output window displays print() output from either all transactions in the debug session, or a specific transaction from the session. See Creating a debug session for details.
entry.summary: You can now view print() output directly within the Debug session viewer. This feature allows you to see output from all transactions or specific ones, aiding in debugging.
entry.title: Feature: Print Output Now Visible in Debugger

entry.content: On September 24, 2025, we released an updated version of Apigee.
entry.summary: A new version of Apigee was released on September 24, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee Update

entry.content:
ApigeeBackendService for the Apigee Operator for Kubernetes (GA)

The ApigeeBackendService resource for the Apigee Operator for Kubernetes is Generally Available (GA).

This new resource enables the integration of the Apigee Operator for Kubernetes with the Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) Inference Gateway. The GKE Inference Gateway is an extension to the GKE Gateway that provides optimized routing and load balancing for serving generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) workloads. It simplifies the deployment, management, and observability of AI inference workloads.

With this new integration, GKE Inference Gateway users can now leverage Apigee's full suite of features to manage, govern and monetize their AI workload through APIs.

To learn more, see Create an ApigeeBackendService.
entry.summary: The Apigee Operator for Kubernetes has reached General Availability, introducing the ApigeeBackendService resource. This feature allows seamless integration with the GKE Inference Gateway, simplifying the management and deployment of AI inference workloads. Users can now utilize Apigee's comprehensive API management capabilities to govern, manage, and monetize their AI services.
entry.title: Feature: Apigee Operator for Kubernetes Now Generally Available

entry.content: On September 19, 2025, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: A new version of the Apigee UI was released on September 19, 2025. This update includes improvements and new features for a better user experience.
entry.title: Announcement: Updated Apigee UI Released

entry.content: | Bug ID | Description | | --- | --- | | 444579842 | Fixed browser hang issue when uploading large bundles. Fixed an issue where the browser would hang when creating a new proxy or proxy revision from a large uploaded zip bundle. |
entry.summary: A bug causing browser hangs during the creation of new proxies or proxy revisions from large zip bundle uploads has been resolved.
entry.title: Fixed: Browser hang issue on large bundle uploads fixed

entry.content: On September 14, 2025, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: A new version of the Apigee UI was released on September 14, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Updated Apigee UI Released

entry.content:
Added icon to proxy and sharedflow editor to mark unused policies

If a policy has yet to be attached to any flow in the configuration, an icon now displays next to that policy in the Proxy Editor side navigation to signify that the policy is currently unused in the proxy or sharedflow.
entry.summary: An icon now indicates policies not yet attached to any flow in the proxy or sharedflow editor.
entry.title: Feature: Unused Policy Icon

entry.content: On August 26, 2025, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: A new version of the Apigee UI was released on August 26, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Updated Apigee UI Released

entry.content:
Debug view settings are now retained when switching between transactions

When switching between transactions in the debug view the following view settings are now retained:

  • The state of the expand all toggle
  • The zoom level of the graph
  • The positioning of the viewport in the graph (best effort). This may be modified due to discrepancies in between the transactions
  • The search filter. The active match will go into an indeterminate when switching transactions.
entry.summary: Debug view settings like expand all toggle, graph zoom level, and search filters are now preserved when navigating between different transactions.
entry.title: Feature: Debug view settings retained across transactions

entry.content:
Added Display name column to Apps table

Added a column to the Apps table to show the App display name separate from the App name. The App name column will no longer show the display name if one is set. Instead the display name will appear in the new Display name column. You can also now filter by the App name and Display name independently.
entry.summary: A new 'Display name' column has been added to the Apps table to show the app's display name separately from its name. You can now filter by App name and Display name independently.
entry.title: Feature: New column in Apps table

entry.content: On August 20, 2025, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: Updated Apigee UI released.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee UI Update

entry.content:
Added Name column to API Products table

Added a column to the API Products table to display the product name. You can now filter and sort by the product name. The link to the API product detail page is now in the Name column instead of the Display Name column.
entry.summary: The API Products table now includes a Name column, allowing for filtering and sorting by product name. The link to the API product detail page has been moved to this new column.
entry.title: Feature: New Name Column in API Products

entry.content: On August 12, 2025, we released an updated version of the Apigee UI.
entry.summary: Updated Apigee UI released on August 12, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee UI Update

entry.content:
Added path column to Debug transaction table

A new column has been added to the transactions table in the Debug view that specifies the path that was used by the transaction to call the proxy.
entry.summary: A new path column is added to the Debug transaction table.
entry.title: Feature: New Path Column in Debug Table

entry.content: | Bug ID | Description | | --- | --- | | 421974963 | Adjusted tooltip positions in Debug sequence view The tooltips for response items in the Debug sequence view now appear at the bottom of the element, so as not to block the elements above. | | 421975987 | You can no longer pan away from the graph in the Debug canvas The Debug canvas is now restricted and will no longer allow you to pan away from the graph. The scroll wheel on the mouse can now also be used to zoom in and out of the graph. | | 421975987 | Debug canvas no longer automatically centers when event elements are clicked When clicking an element in the Debug canvas the canvas will no longer automatically center on the selected item. |
entry.summary: Tooltips adjusted and panning restricted on debug canvas.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixes for Debug View

entry.content:
On July 30, 2025 we began redirecting the following Apigee Classic UI navigation items to Apigee UI in the Google Cloud console:

  • Develop > API Proxies
  • Develop > Shared Flows
  • Develop > Offline Debug

See Apigee UI in Cloud console navigation for a mapping of each Classic Apigee UI feature page to its location in the Apigee UI in Cloud console.

See Apigee Classic UI shutdown for details on shutdown dates.

If you require more time to transition to the Google Cloud console, submit the exception request form by Aug 15, 2025.
entry.summary: Apigee Classic UI navigation items are being redirected to the Apigee UI in the Google Cloud console.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee UI Update

entry.content:
On July 29, 2025 we removed the Switch to Classic option from the following Apigee UI in the Google Cloud console pages:

  • API Proxy
  • Shared Flow
  • Offline Debug detail

This is part of the Apigee Classic UI shutdown plan.

See Apigee UI in Cloud console navigation for a mapping of each Classic Apigee UI feature page to its location in the Apigee UI in Cloud console.

See Apigee Classic UI shutdown for details on shutdown dates.

If you require more time to transition to the Google Cloud console, submit the exception request form by Aug 15, 2025.
entry.summary: The Switch to Classic option has been removed from several Apigee UI pages as part of the Classic UI shutdown plan.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee UI Update

entry.content:
On July 24, 2025 we began redirecting the following Apigee Classic UI navigation items to Apigee UI in the Google Cloud console:

  • Publish > Portals

See Apigee UI in Cloud console navigation for a mapping of each Classic Apigee UI feature page to its location in the Apigee UI in Cloud console.

See Apigee Classic UI shutdown for details on shutdown dates.

If you require more time to transition to the Google Cloud console, submit the exception request form by Aug 15, 2025.
entry.summary: Apigee Classic UI navigation items are being redirected to the Apigee UI in the Google Cloud console. The transition includes changes to Publish > Portals.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee UI Update

entry.content:
On June 25, 2025 we began redirecting the following Apigee Classic UI navigation items to Apigee UI in the Google Cloud console:

  • Publish > API products
  • Publish > Developers
  • Publish > Apps
  • Admin > Instances
  • Admin > Data collectors
  • Admin > Environments
  • Admin > Endpoint attachments

See Apigee UI in Cloud console navigation for a mapping of each Classic Apigee UI feature page to its location in the Apigee UI in Cloud console.

See Apigee Classic UI shutdown for details on shutdown dates.

If you require more time to transition to the Google Cloud console, submit the exception request form by Aug 15, 2025.
entry.summary: Apigee Classic UI navigation items are being redirected to the Apigee UI in the Google Cloud console starting June 25, 2025. You can find a mapping of features and shutdown details in the provided documentation. An exception request form is available until August 15, 2025, for those needing more time to transition.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee Classic UI Navigation Update

entry.content:
On June 17, 2025 we began redirecting the following Apigee Classic UI navigation items to Apigee UI in the Google Cloud console:

  • Publish > Monetization
  • Analyze > API monitoring
  • Analyze > API metrics
  • Analyze > Developers > Developer Engagement
  • Analyze > Developers > Traffic Composition
  • Analyze > End Users > Devices
  • Analyze > End Users > Geomap
  • Analyze > Custom reports

See Apigee UI in Cloud console navigation for a mapping of each Classic Apigee UI feature page to its location in the Apigee UI in Cloud console.

See Apigee Classic UI shutdown for details on shutdown dates.

If you require more time to transition to the Google Cloud console, submit the exception request form by Aug 15, 2025.
entry.summary: Starting June 17, 2025, several Apigee Classic UI navigation items will be redirected to the Apigee UI within the Google Cloud console. This change affects sections related to Monetization, API monitoring, Developer Engagement, Traffic Composition, End User analysis, and Custom reports. For a detailed mapping and information on the Apigee Classic UI shutdown, please refer to the provided documentation. An exception request form is available for those needing more time to transition, with a submission deadline of August 15, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee Classic UI Navigation Changes

entry.content: On May 29, 2025 we announced the shutdown schedule for the Apigee Classic UI.
entry.summary: The Apigee Classic UI will be shut down starting May 29, 2025. More details will be shared soon.
entry.title: Announcement: Apigee Classic UI Shutdown

entry.content:
The Apigee Classic UI will be shutdown as of August 29, 2025.

This is the final phase of moving Apigee to the Google Cloud console. Apigee in the Google Cloud console gives you the ability to manage all of your Apigee functionality in one place.

To prepare for the shutdown of the Apigee Classic UI, familiarize yourself with the new Apigee UI in Google Cloud console by reviewing UI overview.

See Apigee Classic UI shutdown for details on shutdown dates and exception request.
entry.summary: The Apigee Classic UI will be shut down on August 29, 2025, marking the final step in integrating Apigee into the Google Cloud console. This transition aims to consolidate all Apigee management functionalities within the Google Cloud environment. Users are encouraged to explore the new Apigee UI in the Google Cloud console and consult the provided documentation for further details on the shutdown and exception requests.
entry.title: Deprecated: Apigee Classic UI to be shut down
